climatePledgeFriendly.details: OEKO-TEX STANDARD 100 requires textiles-based products to be tested against a list of 1,000+ chemicals, to limit those which may be harmful to human health. Certification focus: #ProductSafety and #ChemicalsUsed.

features: What You Get: A 12 Inch queen size mattress. Assembled in USA. Dimensions: 60*80 Inch.

Hybrid Mattress - The 12 Inch Mattress combine individual pocket springs and memory foam provides excellent support and comfort. The heavy-duty steel coils ensure a durable use while the gel memory foam provides softness to your body.

Peace of Mind Mattress - The king mattress uses CertiPUR-US certified memory foam and OEKO-TEX standard fabric. Besides, it is manufactured without fibreglass in all materials. BedStory produces premium standard mattresses for all your family.

Pocket Spring Mattress - BedStory mattress includes individual pocket coil springs that can move separately, so the queen mattress can effectively reduce disturbance between partners and relax your body and mind during sleep.
Easy Set Up Mattress - The hybrid mattress comes in a carton box that can easily move to your room and is easy to set up. We recommend waiting 24-72 hours to fully expand after opening the package.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 19, 2024
reviews.reviewText: I got this mattress for guest bedroom use. I personally prefer a softer mattress but I'm not the one who's going to sleep on it. On a firmness scale of 1-10 ,10 being the most firm, I like a 2-3. My husband likes at least a 7. Id rate this mattress about a 6-7 from my initial interaction with it. I'm a side sleeper who suffers pressure points on hips and shoulders when a mattress is too firm, so the foam layer helps reduce that to some degree. I currently sleep on a hybrid that I'm comparing this mattress to. My original mattress has a 4 inch thick foam layer, this one is half that contributing to that firmer feeling. If you like a firmer mattress, you should like this one. The springs give you that sense of being well supported while the foam gives a little extra cushion so you don't feel like you are sleeping on a rock.This is a typical bed in a box as far as setup goes. It does need time to breathe and relax after unboxing. Setup is the same as any other bed in box. The materials feel like good quality. I didn't notice anything in the construction that would cause me concern. It's a good value for what it is. Hybrid mattress can be very expensive and usually triple (or more) the price of this one. Based on my initial impression, the overall quality and especially the price, I rate this 5 stars for a good value.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 29, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great mattress for the price
reviews.reviewText: We got this mattress as a budget mattress to replace our old guest room mattress that is sagging. I ended up sleeping for quite a few nights on it. For the price, it is definitely beyond my expectation. I prefer firmer mattresses. While this is not a firm as I did like (probably 6-6.5 out of 10, 7.5 to 8 out of 10 would probably be ideal for me), the mattress is very comfortable and very supportive. I can't speak about the isolation of motion, as I slept on it by myself. The comfort and support is quite uniform across the entire mattress. You will need a few days to let the mattress expand to its full firmness, as I definitely see the difference between day one and day three. But overall, if you like medium firmness, this mattress is of great value for the comfort level. Highly recommended.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 8, 2024
reviews.reviewText: This mattress is very comfortable. My guests love it. They get good sleep on it. Definitely recommend getting this.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 20, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars OH MY GOODNESS !!!
reviews.reviewText: This might be my favorite mattress ever!!. It's firm when you sit on the bed, but it conforms to your body when you lie down. I loved it, last evening and I look forward to night number two, tonight. I was sleeping on a night double for a good while, now, and I thought that a queen wouldn't mean that much more to me. I was wrong!! Those extra inches, for a man that's 6'2" make all the difference ... width and length. The springs are added support and that layer of memory foam matters. You will love this mattress. One word of caution ... open it in the room it's going to go. Once it starts to inflate, it is not a lightweight mattress.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 31, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars So far so good..
reviews.reviewText: Be careful when unwrapping this mattress! It’s wrapped several times so it takes some time and finesse cutting through it (can’t really use a box-cutter due to the risk of slicing the fabric) with scissors.Since it’s vacuum sealed and trying to inflate while it’s being opened, when there was only a small amount of plastic left, it burst fully open(unrolled itself) due to the pressure and luckily mostly went in the other direction! 😅 I’d recommend opening it in the center of the bed frame or box spring so it can spring open in a safe area.Just make sure kids or pets aren’t around the area where it’s being opened!It was 11” as soon as it unfolded, and 12” in some spots an hour later. Two days later now though and no change. It’s still 11.5-12 inches (measures differently in different spots 12” is the tallest) I hope it’ll finish fluffing up to it’s full 14” after a few days but I don’t see how since it’s hasn’t risen an additional fraction of an inch. Will update!The topside of the mattress is really beautiful. The underside is that very thin cheap felt material, the same kind usually stapled to the underside of box springs. Easy enough to replace or repair if it tears, but I suppose I was expecting a bit of a nicer finish on the bottom side.As far as comfort, it’s already comfortable sans the final inch of floof! Pretty firm but also soft. We use mattress toppers so we prefer the firmer mattresses since they seem to last much longer.It fit on my full size platform bed frame perfectly. The handles on the sides were VERY helpful to get it into place and to lift the mattress a bit to adjust the bed-skirt that shifted underneath while getting it into place.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 28, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars High Quality Mattress
reviews.reviewText: A really high quality mattress in a box at a really good price. This mattress compares to some much more expensive mattresses that I've tried and is definitely better than a cheap mattress with a topper on it.. Very happy with this and haven't had any issues with sleep or waking up sore.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 17, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Takes time to inflate, but worth it
reviews.reviewText: This mattress is a hybrid one, meaning it has both memory foam on top, and stiff springs underneath, like a traditional mattress does. Still, unboxing it and setting it up takes time because the foam and the mattress itself has to fully inflate back to its prescribed size of 12 inches. The mattress takes about 2-3 days to inflate, which is a long time for some, but it's well required in order to gain its maximum size back. It arrives vacuum sealed and shrunken, and in a slim box, so you do the math. Still, once it's set up it is comfortable and provides a lot more support than a pure foam mattress does. My parents like it more than their aged one, so I'm happy with it.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 6, 2024
reviews.reviewText: I am very happy with my new mattress. It is awesome. It was so easy to open up and it is super comfortable. I am so excited to sleep on it tonight so far feels wonderful and I am very excited. I definitely recommend these mattress to anyone.
